com.intel.fightclub.dialog.logging.xml.core

Class XmlLogWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.fightclub.dialog.logging.xml.core.XmlLogWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    @NotThreadSafe
public final class XmlLogWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable
    A manager class that can take in several XmlLogPlugin instances with each instance containing the necessary logic to write whatever information it needs to an XML file. This class is not thread-safe.

      Prepares the log writer for use.

      Deprecated. 
      The ability to append to a file will be deprecated in the next major release of the logging library.
      <T> XmlLogWriter write(java.lang.String pluginId, T arg)

    • Method Detail

      • addPlugin

        public final void addPlugin(@NonNull
                            java.lang.String pluginId,
                            @NonNull
                            XmlLogPlugin<?> plugin)
        Adds an XmlLogPlugin plugin.
        Parameters:
        pluginId - A unique plugin ID for this plugin instance. An exception will be thrown if this plugin ID has already been registered.
        plugin - The plugin to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if another plugin with this ID has already been registered or if the provided plugin ID is an empty string.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if one of the parameters is null.

      • prepare

        @Deprecated
public XmlLogWriter prepare(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.String saveFile)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. The ability to append to a file will be deprecated in the next major release of the logging library.
        Prepares the log writer for use. Must be called prior to use as it also prepares the various plugins for use. When the close() method is called, it will move the temporary file to the provided path.
        Parameters:
        saveFile - The file to save the XML to.
        Returns:
        An instance to this log writer so that various method calls can be chained.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the save file is null or is an empty string.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if this method has been called in the past and has not been closed with close().
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is an error preparing the file output stream.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the save file path is null.

      • prepare

        public XmlLogWriter prepare(@NonNull
                            DataWriter outputStream,
                            boolean writeXmlStartDocument)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Prepares the log writer for use. Must be called prior to use as it also prepares the various plugins for use. This will write generated XML to the provided OutputStream object. You must still call close() to finalize the XML which will also close the output stream for you.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - The output stream to write XML to.
        writeXmlStartDocument - Whether or not the XML start document tag should be written to the stream.
        Returns:
        An instance to this writer so that various method calls can be chained.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is an error preparing the output stream.

      • write

        public <T> XmlLogWriter write(@NonNull
                              java.lang.String pluginId,
                              @NonNull
                              T arg)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Instructs the writer to call the XmlLogPlugin.writeToXml(Object) method of the plugin with the given ID using the provided parameters. This will append the XML to the file that is currently being written.
        Parameters:
        pluginId - The ID of the plugin to invoke.
        arg - Parameter to pass into the plugin.
        Returns:
        An instance to this writer so that various method calls can be chained.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the provided plugin ID is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the prepare(String) method has not been called beforehand.
        java.io.IOException

      • beginGroup

        @NonNull
public XmlLogWriter beginGroup(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.String name)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a starting XML tag. Make sure to close this tag using the endGroup() method.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the XML tag.
        Returns:
        An instance to this writer so that various method calls can be chained.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the prepare(String) method has not been called beforehand.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the start tag for the group could not be written.

      • endGroup

        @NonNull
public XmlLogWriter endGroup()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the ending XML tag. Just takes the last tag that was written from the beginGroup(String) method. Therefore, care must be taken to ensure that each beginGroup(String) call has a corresponding endGroup call.
        Returns:
        An instance to this writer so that various method calls can be chained.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the prepare(String) method has not been called beforehand.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the end tag for the group could not be written.

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Specified by:
        flush in interface java.io.Flushable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the contents of the buffer to an XML file.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the prepare(String) method has not been called beforehand.
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the XML document could not be ended or if the file stream could not be closed.
